context.p: This section provides detailed configuration instructions for each of the four Eucalyptus networking modes. Eucalyptus requires network connectivity between its clients (end-users) and the cloud components (CC, CLC, and Walrus).

ul.li: In Managed and Managed (No VLAN) modes, traffic to instances pass through the CC. In these two modes clients must be able to connect to the CC.
In System and Static modes, clients need to connect directly to the NC. The CC does not act as a router in these two modes.

context.p: The /etc/eucalyptus/eucalyptus.conf file contains all network-related options in in the “Networking Configuration” section. These options use the prefix VNET_.
